meanings.definition: A person who performs menial tasks or runs errands for someone else.
meanings.sent1: The flunkeys at the office always make sure the coffee is hot.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy lady had several flunkeys to attend to her needs.
meanings.sent3: The flunkeys in the movie were always comically tripping over themselves.
meanings.sent4: She treated her assistants like flunkeys, expecting them to do everything for her.
meanings.sent5: The image of the flunkeys scurrying around the mansion stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: To act as a flunkey or servant.
meanings.sent1: He would flunkey around the house, doing whatever was asked of him.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to flunkey for anyone else after her bad experience.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to flunkey happily, fetching the ball over and over.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to flunkey for her boss to keep her job.
meanings.sent5: The children loved to watch their dad flunkey around, pretending to be a butler.

meanings.sent1: The room was filled with flunkeys, all waiting for their next task.
meanings.sent2: The flunkeys were dressed in matching uniforms for the event.
meanings.sent3: The flunkeys gathered around the table, eager to begin their work.
meanings.sent4: She felt overwhelmed by the number of flunkeys in the room.
meanings.sent5: The group of flunkeys moved in unison, like a well-oiled machine.
